input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: MSSCCMActor.

Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <target>config2</target> <availability-state>Online</availability-state> <component-name>SMS_SITE_SYSTEM_STATUS_SUMMARIZER</component-name> <component-type>Monitored Thread Component</component-type> <errors>1</errors> <heartbeat-interval>62</heartbeat-interval> <information>41</information> <last-status-message>20101230221402.000000+***</last-status-message> <last-heartbeat>20110103095858.000000+***</last-heartbeat> <last-started>20101230221402.000000+***</last-started> <site-system>WIN2K3-VM5</site-system> <next-scheduled-time>20110103100000.000000+***</next-scheduled-time> <site-code>123</site-code> <thread-state>STARTED</thread-state> <status>OK</status> <tally-interval>0001128000080008</tally-interval> <startup-type>AUTOSTARTING</startup-type> <warning>0</warning> </item> </items>
Elements' Description:
item [Required] This is a child tag of <items> tag. The <item> tag can be specified multiple times to support "multiple items support".
target [Optional]: This element to specify the connection information for the Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager application.
Valid values: The value specified for <target> XML element must be same as the value that has been specified for the name attribute of <config> element in Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Default value: If this element is not provided or left empty, the request will be executed on the first defined Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Note: The value of this tag is case sensitive.
availability-state [Optinal] Availability state of the component. Valid values: Online, Failed, Unknown
component-name [Optional] Name of the Configuration Manager component.
component-type [Optional] The component type.
errors [Optional] Count of all error status messages reported by the component during the tally interval.
heartbeat-interval [Optional] The heartbeat interval.
information [Optional] Count of all informational status messages reported by the component during the tally interval.
last-status-message [Optional] Date and time of when a status message was last received from the component. The time zone is based on the time zone of the site specified in the site-code.
last-heartbeat [Optional] Date-time of the last heartbeat.
last-started [Optional] Date and time when the component last started. The time zone is based on the time zone of the site specified in the SiteCode property.
site-system [Optional] Name of the computer on which the component is installed. Note, some components might run on computers other than the site server.
next-scheduled-time [Optional] Date-time when the component is next scheduled to start, if the component runs according to a schedule. The time zone is based on the time zone of the SiteCode property.
site-code [Optional] Site code of the Configuration Manager site to which the component is related.
thread-state [Optional] State of the component. Valid values: STOPPED, STARTED, PAUSED, INSTALLING, RE_INSTALLING, DE_INSTALLING
status [Optional] Status value indicating the health of the component. Valid values: OK, Warning, Critical
tally-interval [Optional] Interval for which the site status is to be searched.
Valid values: 0001128000100008, 0081128000100008, 0101128000100008, 0181128000100008, 0201128000100008, 0281128000100008, 0001128000192000, 00011280001A2000, 00011280001B2000, 00011280001C2000, 00011280001D2000, 00011280001E2000, 00011280001F2000, 000A470000284400, 000A4700002BC400, 0001128000080008
Description of these values is as follows :-
0001128000100008 -> Since 12:00AM 0081128000100008 -> Since 04:00AM 0101128000100008 -> Since 08:00AM 0181128000100008 -> Since 12:00PM 0201128000100008 -> Since 04:00PM 0281128000100008 -> Since 08:00PM 0001128000192000 -> Since Sunday 00011280001A2000 -> Since Monday 00011280001B2000 -> Since Tuesday 00011280001C2000 -> Since Wednesday 00011280001D2000 -> Since Thursday 00011280001E2000 -> Since Friday 00011280001F2000 -> Since Saturday 000A470000284400 -> Since 1st of month 000A4700002BC400 -> Since 15th of month 0001128000080008 -> Since site installation
startup-type [Optional] Type of component. For example, one that autostarts (runs continuously). Valid values: AUTOSTARTING, SCHEDULED, and MANUAL
warnings [Optional] Count of all warning status messages reported by the component during the tally interval.

output.description: Returned adapter response is captured in this context parameter.

documentation.description:
Find Site Component Status
This wrapper finds status of a site component.
